      • getSIPStatusInfo

        SIPStatusInfo getSIPStatusInfo(java.lang.String SipId,
                               boolean numberOfIEs)
                        throws java.lang.Exception

        API for getting the SIP Info

        The service returns SipStatusInfo that holds the Module the sip is currently in, including Status, Stage, External Id, External system, and its number of IEs if the numberOfIEs flag is set to true. The Status and Stage depends on the Module value according to the following conditions:

        If the Module = "DEP" then Status can be one of the following options: DRAFT, REJECTED, DECLINED, APPROVED, ERROR, INPROCESS, INCOMPLETE, DELETED
        The Stage can be one of the following options: "null","Deposit","Loading","Validation","Assessor","Arranger","Approver","Bytestream","Enrichment","ToPermanent","Finished"

        Else if the Module = "REP" / "PER" then Status can be one of the following options: CREATED, WAITING, ACTIVE, REJECT, DECLINE, REJECT_CONTENT, FINISHED, IN_HUMAN_STAGE, IN_TA
        The Stage can be one of the following options: "null","Deposit","Loading","Validation","Assessor","Arranger","Approver","Bytestream","Enrichment","ToPermanent","Finished"

        Else if the Module = "NONE" then Status = DELETED
        The Stage will be: "null"

        Parameters:
        SipId -
        numberOfIEs - a boolean flag, false by default (optional)
        Returns:
        SipStatusInfo SipId, Module, Status, Stage, External Id, External System (, number of IEs)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getSIPsStatusInfo

        java.util.List<SIPStatusInfo> getSIPsStatusInfo(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sipId,
                                                boolean numberOfIEs)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception

        API for getting a list of SipStatusInfo objects by list of SIP IDs

        The service gets a list of SIP IDs and returns a list of SipStatusInfo objects. Each object holds the Module the SIP is currently in, including Status, Stage, External Id, External system and its number of IEs if the numberOfIEs flag is set to true. The Status and Stage depends on the Module value according to the conditions described for the getSIPStatusInfo method. In case the SIP isn't found, the corresponding SipStatusInfo object will hold an error. Limited to 1000 SIP IDs. When the limit exceeded, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        sipId - A list of SIPs id
        numberOfIEs - a boolean flag, false by default (optional)
        Returns:
        A list of SipStatusInfo objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getSipIEs

        java.lang.String getSipIEs(java.lang.String sipId)
        API for getting the IEs related to a certain SIP

      • getSIPStatusInfoByExternalId

        java.util.List<SIPStatusInfo> getSIPStatusInfoByExternalId(java.lang.String externalSystem,
                                                           java.lang.String externalId,
                                                           boolean numberOfIEs)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception

        API for getting the SIP Status Info by external ID

        The service returns one or more SipStatusInfo objects that hold the Module the SIP is currently in, including Status, Stage, External Id, External system and its number of IEs if the numberOfIEs flag is set to true. The Status and Stage depends on the Module value according to the conditions described for the getSIPStatusInfo method.

        Parameters:
        externalSystem - an external system identifier (optional)
        externalId - an external ID assigned to the SIP (mandatory)
        numberOfIEs - a boolean flag, false by default (optional)
        Returns:
        SipStatusInfo
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
